content:
C header-only library that takes the "emulate instructions" approach: https://github.com/simd-everywhere/simde
https://simd-everywhere.github.io/blog/2020/06/22/transitioning-to-arm-with-simde.html
I think emulating the entire API surface of x86 is what I would call A Bit Ambitious, but it's quite interesting that they target such.
Kind of funny--this is basically the opposite of stdsimd
I wouldn't say Opposite, but I would say Mirror Universe Counterpart. Like it is subtly evocative y'know, but has a goatee and a golden sash.
Yeah, that's a good description. It's cursed but in a charming way.

Mmmhm. ;^)
I would say Wasm SIMD is the "total opposite", because it defines "the most virtualizable ISA for known systems" instead of "virtualize every ISA for known systems".

Jubilee said:

I think emulating the entire API surface of x86 is what I would call A Bit Ambitious, but it's quite interesting that they target such.

yeah, even https://github.com/DLTcollab/sse2neon calls it quits for AVX and beyond
